info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 24 at 12:28PM CDT until April 24 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, East Baton Rouge and West Baton Rouge.
* WHEN...Until 130 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1228 PM CDT, broadcast media reported flooding on and around the LSU campus. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - On and around the LSU campus is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, Merrydale, Westminster, Inniswold, Gardere, Brownfields, Village St. George, Shenandoah, Old Jefferson and Baton Rouge Airport. - This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 152 and 165. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 6. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge, LA; West Baton Rouge, LA
